creator: mhuffman@ca.ibm.com
text:
According to XML Schema Structures spec:

http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-1/#cos-all-limited

An <all> child of a <complexType> must have minOccurs=maxOccurs="1". Here is an 
example test which violates this constraint but is not reported as an error by 
the parser.

3_8si05.xml
===========
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<si:root xmlns:xsi         ="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
         xmlns:si          ="http://www.schemaTest.org/3_8si"
         xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.schemaTest.org/3_8si
                             3_8si05.xsd">
</si:root>

3_8si05.xsd
===========
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<schema xmlns          ="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"
        xmlns:si       ="http://www.schemaTest.org/3_8si"
        targetNamespace="http://www.schemaTest.org/3_8si">

<complexType name="badType">
  <all minOccurs="0">
    <element name="elem1" type="string"/>
    <element name="elem2" type="string"/>
  </all>
</complexType>

<element name="root" type="string"/>

</schema>
